recent_posts.title: Nucleus: Capital-efficient multipeer Lightning payment channels

- The proposal enables direct joining of peers, enhancing scalability and simplifying the payment process.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- Schnorr Musig2 protocol is being implemented for statechains, with blinded server (party 1).
- Blinded statechains rely on server's reporting of partial signatures for a key.
- Private key generation, aggregation, and signing steps are defined for the protocol.

active_posts.title: Ark: An Alternative Privacy-preserving Second Layer Solution
active_posts.summary:
- Ark, a new second-layer protocol design, has been released as an alternative to Lightning.
- Ark allows users to send and receive funds without liquidity constraints and consumes less on-chain footprint.
- Virtual UTXOs (vTXOs) are used off-chain, which must be spent within four weeks, and anonymity is improved.

active_posts.title: BIP-352 Silent Payments addresses should have an expiration time
active_posts.summary:
- Wallets should add an expiration date to Silent Payment addresses to avoid mistakes.
- The expiration date can be encoded in a 3 byte or 2 byte field.
- Default expiration period should be set and expired addresses should fail payment attempts.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal suggests a new way to make lightning channels resumable from a wallet seed by introducing a new type of channel funding transaction.
- The roles in this channel are asymmetric, with Alice as the client and Bob as the server.
- The proposal also introduces fraud proofs to detect revoked states and suggests ways to save bandwidth.

active_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
active_posts.summary:
- We are conducting a "dry run" of HTLC endorsement and reputation tracking using real-world data.
- The plan includes collecting forwarding data, propagating an experimental TLV, and implementing local reputation algorithms.
- Privacy is prioritized and node operators are encouraged to participate in data collection.
